string-array.name: paroimies
string-array.item: Don’t judge a book by its cover
Strike while the iron is hot
Too many cooks spoil the broth
You can’t have your cake and eat it too
Many hands make light work
Don’t cross the bridge until you come to it
Honesty is the best policy
Practice makes perfect
Where there’s a will, there’s a way
Look before you leap
Don’t make a mountain out of an anthill.
An apple a day keeps the doctor away
The early bird catches the worm
Better late than never
The cat is out of the bag
Two wrongs don’t make a right
Always put your best foot forward
It’s better to be safe than sorry
Don’t bite the hand that feeds you
The squeaky wheel gets the grease
Don’t bite off more than you can chew
You made your bed, now you have to lie in it
Actions speak louder than words
It takes two to tango
Don’t count your chickens before they hatch
It’s no use crying over spilled milk
Don’t put all your eggs Ignorance is blissin one basket
People in glass houses shouldn’t throw stones
A rolling stone gathers no moss
First things first
Still waters run deep
If it ain\'t broke, don\'t fix it
Curiosity killed the cat
Learn to walk before you run
Money doesn’t grow on trees
My hands are tied
It’s the tip of the iceberg
No news is good news
Out of sight, out of mind
If you scratch my back, I’ll scratch yours
Ignorance is bliss
Easy come, easy go
The forbidden fruit is always the sweetest
Every cloud has a silver lining
You can’t make an omelet without breaking a few eggs
Close but no cigar
The pen is mightier than the sword
No man is an island
Fortune favors the bold
Hope for the best, but prepare for the worst
Keep your friends close and your enemies closer
A picture is worth a thousand words
There\'s no such thing as a free lunch
There\'s no place like home
Discretion is the greater part of valor
Never look a gift horse in the mouth
You can\'t always get what you want
Cleanliness is next to godliness
Beggars can\'t be choosers
A watched pot never boils
All good things must come to an end
If you can\'t beat \'em, join \'em
One man\'s trash is another man\'s treasure
There\'s no time like the present
Beauty is in the eye of the beholder
Necessity is the mother of invention
A penny saved is a penny earned
Familiarity breeds contempt
Good things come to those who wait
The grass is always greener on the other side of the hill
Do unto others as you would have them do unto you
A chain is only as strong as its weakest link
Absence makes the heart grow fonder
You can lead a horse to water, but you can not make him drink
If you want something done right, you have to do it yourself
A barking dog never bites
A dog is a man\'s best friend
A friend in need is a friend indeed
A fish always rots from the head down
A drowning man will clutch at a straw
A golden key can open any door
A good beginning makes a good ending
A good man is hard to find
A house is not a home
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step
A man is known by his friends
A poor workman always blames his tools
A problem shared is a problem halved
Accidents will happen
Absolute power corrupts absolutely
After a storm comes a calm
All roads lead to Rome
All that glitters is not gold
An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth
Ashes to ashes dust to dust
Ask no questions and hear no lies
Big fish eat little fish
Boys will be boys
Business before pleasure
Cheaters never win and winners never cheat
Children and fools tell the truth
Christmas comes but once a year
Comparisons are odious
Count your blessings
Cut your coat to suit your cloth
Dead men tell no tales
Do as I say, not as I do
Do not burn your bridges behind you
Do not cast your pearls before swine
Do not get mad, get even
Do not keep a dog and bark yourself
Do not leave your manners on the doorstep
Do not let the bastards grind you down
Do not teach your Grandma to suck eggs
Do not throw the baby out with the bathwater
Doubt is the beginning not the end of wisdom
Early to bed and early to rise, makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise
Eat, drink and be merry, for tomorrow we die
Enough is enough
Even a worm will turn
Every dog has its day
Every man has his price
Every picture tells a story
Every stick has two ends
Everyone wants to go to heaven but nobody wants to die
Faith will move mountains
Fight fire with fire
Finders keepers, losers weepers
Fine words butter no parsnips
First come, first served
First impressions are the most lasting
Forgive and forget
Fortune favours the brave
God helps those who help themselves
Good things come in small packages
Haste makes waste
He who fights and runs away, may live to fight another day
He who laughs last laughs longest
History repeats itself
Home is where the heart is
If anything can go wrong, it will
If the shoe fits, wear it
Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery
Into every life a little rain must fall
It goes without saying
It takes a thief to catch a thief
It takes all sorts to make a world
It\'s never too late
It\'s the singer not the song
Know which side your bread is buttered
Laughter is the best medicine
Least said, soonest mended
Less is more
Let not the sun go down on your wrath
Let bygones be bygones
Let sleeping dogs lie
Let the punishment fit the crime
Life is just a bowl of cherries
Lightning never strikes twice in the same place
Like father, like son
Little things please little minds
Live and learn
Live for today for tomorrow never comes
Love is blind
Love makes the world go round
Love will find a way
Make love not war
Many are called but few are chosen
Might is right
Money isn\'t everything
Nature abhors a vacuum
Never go to bed on an argument
Never put off until tomorrow what you can do today
Never speak ill of the dead
No pain, no gain
No rest for the wicked
Nothing new under the sun
Once a thief, always a thief
Once bitten, twice shy
One man\'s meat is another man\'s poison
One swallow does not make a summer
One volunteer is worth ten pressed men
One year\'s seeding makes seven years weeding
Only fools and horses work
Patience is a virtue
Pearls of wisdom
Prevention is better than cure
Pride goes before a fall
Revenge is a dish best served cold
Rome wasn\'t built in a day
Seeing is believing
Silence is golden
Slow but sure
Spare the rod and spoil the child
Talk is cheap
The apple never falls far from the tree
The best defence is a good offence
The best things in life are free
The bigger, the better
The bigger they are, the harder they fall
The boy is father to the man
The customer is always right
The darkest hour is just before the dawn
The exception which proves the rule
The husband is always the last to know
The more the merrier
The more things change, the more they stay the same
The way to a man\'s heart is through his stomach
There\'s always more fish in the sea
There\'s no smoke without fire
There\'s no such thing as bad publicity
Third time lucky
Those who do not learn from history are doomed to repeat it
Time is a great healer
Tomorrow is another day
Two blacks don\'t make a white
When the cat\'s away the mice will play
You are what you eat
You win some, you lose some
Youth is wasted on the young
You catch more flies with honey than with vinegar
